item.title: Ep554: Dina Fine | VP R&D, TailorMed
item.description: I am Dina Fine, VP R&D at TailorMed Medical, a comprehensive software solution with a mission to help patients and healthcare providers tackle the financial challenges of care delivery. Prior to Tailormed, I was VP R&D Data Collection and B2C at SimilarWeb. I bring almost 20 years of experience in building high-performance, scalable and robust systems. I am passionate about leading high-paced RnD departments, setting up solid and effective development life cycles, with a focus on technological excellence and high standards.

item.title: Ep553: Gil Ben-Artzy | Founding Partner, UpWest
item.description: Gil is the Founding Partner of UpWest, the only Seed fund that's purposefully designed to help Israeli startups break into the US market.  Headquartered in Silicon Valley and operating since 2012, UpWest was the first investor in SentineOne, HoneyBook and 80 other startups that raised over $2B in follow-on funding from top US VCs. Prior to UpWest, Gil was the VP of Operations Management at Yahoo! after working with the company's Corporate Development group. Gil also served as a consultant advising Fortune 500 companies for the Boston Consulting Group in New York.

item.title: Ep552: Massimiliano Magrini | Founder and Managing Partner, United Ventures
item.description: Massimiliano Magrini has always worked at the intersection of business and technology, that being the thread across his career from launching the operations of Altavista and Google Italy as founding country manager to creating an avant-garde VC studio in 2009 and then co-founding in 2013 United Ventures, the Milan-based independent venture capital firm investing in digital technologies. Today, Massimiliano’s mission is to back extraordinary founders along their journey to build great companies, from the early to the growth stage. He provides strategic guidance to portfolio companies and leads the investment thesis on game-changing technologies, aimed at the creation of long-term value.

item.title: Ep551: Eli Bejerano | CEO, Bit2C
item.description: Eli is the CEO of Bit2C, a company that has developed a trading platform that enables the buying and selling of cryptocurrencies against the shekel, along with the management and preservation of digital currencies and the realization of large-scale transactions. 8 years ago he sat on the sofa playing video games with a friend and thought about opening a company that will make Bitcoin accessible.

item.title: Ep550: Gad Allon | Director of the Jerome Fisher Program in Management & Technology
item.description: Gad Allon is the Jeffrey A. Keswin Professor and Professor of Operations, Information and Decisions, and the director of the Management and Technology Program at the University of Pennsylvania. He is an award-winning educator, teaching courses on scaling technology ventures and operations strategy. Gad’s recent research primarily considers gig workers, quick decision-making, and the communication between firms and customers. He is the co-founder of ForClass, helping professors drive higher student engagement and accountability in the classroom.

item.title: Ep549: Baratang Miya | CEO, GirlHYPE
item.description: Baratang is an award-winning tech founder and a self-taught software developer with robust problem-solving skills and proven experience in building tech startups, incubators, co-working spaces, and creating, designing software in a test-driven environment. She is the founder of the first African software engineering school focusing on women and girls and worked tirelessly to mobilize governments, corporations, and civil society to invest in women and girls education.

item.title: Ep548: Ouriel Ohayon | CEO, ZenGo
item.description: Ouriel is the CEO of ZenGo, a new generation of All-in-one crypto wallet focused on simplicity and safety. He’s a former executive at ICQ/AOL, founder of TechCrunch France (sold to AOL), Isai.fr (leading French VC) and was general manager of the internet Lab of Gemini and Lightspeed Ventures. Ouriel is French and Israeli, based in Tel Aviv

item.title: Ep547: Nobukhosi Dlamini | Founder, Bahati Tech
item.description: Nobukhosi Dlamini is a tech founder of Bahati Tech - a cybersecurity and data protection company with headquarters in Cape Town, South Africa. She is also the Founder and Executive Director of the GIFT Foundation, which is a non-profit organization focused on assisting rural and informal settlement-based young women to acquire technical and digital skills to improve their livelihoods and break the cycle of poverty.

item.title: Ep546: Tomer Kashi | Co-Founder & CEO, VOOM Insurance
item.description: Tomer Kashi is CEO and Co-Founder of VOOM, an InsurTech company for next-gen mobility insurance products. Previously, Tomer spearheaded interdisciplinary technology projects from within the Prime Minister’s Office in Israel, including a project that has received the "Israel Defense Prize". Tomer is a "Talpiot" graduate and has a  BSc in computer science and physics from The Hebrew University of Jerusalem and an MBA from Tel Aviv University. Tomer is based in Tel Aviv and is a proud father of two little daughters.

item.title: Ep545: Sepideh Nasiri | Founder & CEO, Women Of MENA In Technology
item.description: Sepideh Nasiri is the CEO and Founder of Women of the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) in Technology (previously known as Persian Women In Tech). She is an award-winning serial entrepreneur with over 16 years of experience in the Tech Industry, and a lifetime advocate for women, diversity, and inclusion. Prior, she was Co-founder and Managing Editor of a digital and print Los Angeles Magazine, and later as the Vice President of Women 2.0, with over 250,000 members worldwide and partnerships with many tech companies and Corps, which was acquired in 2016.

item.title: Ep544: Alaina Percival | CEO and co-founder, Women Who Code
item.description: Alaina Percival is CEO and co-founder of Women Who Code. Under Alaina’s leadership, the organization has grown to serve 290,000 members in 134 countries. Alaina is an accomplished tech speaker, appearing at WSJ.d Live, CodeMotion Milan, Grace Hopper, Columbia University’s Social Enterprise, and more. Alaina has been published by Forbes, Huffington Post, and The Wall Street Journal.  Alaina holds a Master’s in Organizational Management and an MBA. She is also an Angel Investor, a Venture Partner at Valor Ventures, serves on the Board of ATLFamily meal, and is a CodePath Advisor.

item.title: Ep543: Arik Faingold | Chairman, Comm-IT
item.description: Arik is an entrepreneur and advisor to startups and capital fund groups, and the President of Commit. He has over 20 years of business development experience in the global technology sector, combined with a vast knowledge of software design, development, and system architecture. Arik successfully completed a number of exits and co-founded several ventures, including Pentera (formerly Pcysys) a fully automated, self-learning penetration tests solution that mimics the hacker's mindset, and Betting Corp which provided gaming platforms and real-time transaction management.

item.title: Ep542: Omri Paz | Founder & CEO, Vegan Friendly
item.description: Omri Paz has a Law degree from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. In 2012 he founded Vegan Friendly which is the leading vegan organization in Israel. Since it was established, Vegan Friendly launched many campaigns that reached millions of people including the biggest animal rights march in history, massive billboards, vegan ads on prime time, and the 10 million lecture.

item.title: Ep541: Roman Itskovich | Founder and Chief Risk Officer, At-Bay
item.description: Roman is the co-founder and chief risk officer of At-Bay, A cyber Insurer. Digital risk is complex and constantly evolving, with breaches in the news all the time driving trillions of annual losses to society. At-Bay helps businesses prevent cyber loss before it happens, and insure them for when the loss couldn't be avoided. Our modern approach to risk management has kept At-Bay ahead of the pack, anticipating new threats and identifying vulnerabilities to help keep insureds secure.

item.title: Ep540: Antonio Franchino | Director, Art & Luxury Investments Fund
item.description: Antonio is a lawyer and in the last 25 years has managed the criminal litigation of an important banking and financial group. He also managed all the compliance activities with particular reference to the activity of the Anti-Money Laundering and fight against terrorism activities. In the last years, he has been a member of the Board of several Reserved Alternative Investment Funds. Today, he is the Managing Director of Art & Luxury Investment Fund.

item.title: Ep539: Maurizio Rossi | Founder and CoCEO, H-FARM
item.description: Pioneer in the startup business and Venture Capital in Italy, Maurizio is cofounder of H-FARM, having incubated and invested in over 140 companies. The organization went public in 2015 and has expanded to an education hub of 51 hectares for 3000 students. In his previous experiences, Maurizio worked in the luxury and sporting goods industries, some involving acquisitions by global leaders such as LVMH fashion holding and other majors sports brands. If in the past Maurizio managed to distinguish himself in the world of sports as a champion in offshore racing, today Maurizio is committed to running after his 4 children and more than 350 startuppers.

item.title: Ep538: Eyal Gruner | CEO & Founder, CYNET
item.description:
Eyal Gruner founded Cynet in 2015. He started his journey in the cybersecurity world when he was 15 when he uncovered a breach in the ATM machine of a large Israeli bank and a high-tech company. They both eventually hired him as a cybersecurity expert while he was still in high school. 

At the age of 16, he founded his first cybersecurity consultancy company, BugSec, which become one of the biggest consulting companies in Israel. After his military service, he founded a startup called Versafe and sold it to F5 Networks at the age of 24 for $100 million. Eyal founded Cynet with the goal of building a “truly big company”."

item.title: Ep537: Dotan Bar Noy | Co-founder & CEO, Authomize
item.description: Dotan is Authomize's Co-Founder & CEO. Prior to co-founding Authomize, Dotan led the product management for the “Infinity Next” platform at Check Point Software, following the successful acquisition of ForceNock Security, where he served as Co-founder & CEO. He also founded and served as CEO at ReSec Tech. Dotan is also a member of the Technion Board of Governors - Israel Institute of Technology.

item.title: Ep536: Ami Aharonovich | General Manager, Aerospike Israel
item.description: I’m a technology Geek with over 20 years of experience in the world of databases. I’m eager to continuously learn and improve while removing obstacles out of the way. I’m keen to reach success and always strive to achieve a true win-win. I believe that doing business is “all about the people”, and finding the shared road to success. For 8 years, I worked for John Bryce and delivered technical database training for thousands of people globally, following that I founded my training and services boutique company and after 10 years I had the opportunity to kickstart the Aerospike Israel entity, which I’ve been leading since 2018.

item.description: Nimrod is a co-founder and Head of Product at BigID. He is experienced in enterprise product and a security executive and served in various capacities ranging from engineering, product and business management. Prior to founding BigID, Nimrod served as VP Product Management, Product Line Manager for CA Identity Management product line and as an advisor to security startups in the area of identity management and user behavior analytics.

item.description: Chen is co-founder and co CEO of DeePathology, and also co-founder of SagivTech and SurgeonAI. She has a Ph.D. in Applied Math from Tel Aviv University specializing in Computer Vision. Chen loves Math and the mix of algorithms and healthcare. She lives in Gaash with her husband, twin girls, and two dogs.

item.title: Ep533: Eran Fine | CEO and Co - Founder, NanoLock Security
item.description: Eran is the co-founder and CEO of Nanolock security from day 1. He was a consultant to Cimagine that was sold to Snapchat and was the co-founder and CEO of OREE that were acquired in 2015. He was a senior consultant to Tel Aviv University Nanolock Science center and Tsinghua University in Beijing, China’s MIT. Eran was also the co-founder of  On-Eden that was sold to the formula group and created  5 comedy shows among them the highly successful show, The Leash.

item.title: Ep532: Isaac Heller | CEO, Trullion
item.description: Isaac is the co-founder and CEO of Trullion, an AI-powered SaaS platform that automates financial workflows for CFOs, accountants, and auditors. Trullion unifies the unstructured and structured worlds of accounting by reading PDFs and Excel and translating them into financial workflows, such as Lease Accounting and Revenue Recognition.

item.title: Ep531: Idan Hershko | Co-Founder, Avo
item.description: Idan is a co-founder at Avo, a fast-growing e-commerce startup focused on reducing costs for consumers by aggregating demand. Before starting Avo Idan started a couple of other companies and was also an early employee at Monday.com. He was also the founder of a podcast called startup camel, where he interviewed over 80 founders from the Israeli start-up scene.

item.description: Marius Hanganu has been a manager in the software industry for over 20 years. He has been overseeing complex projects from sales to deployment and support. item.title: Ep528: Anna Collard | SVP of Content Strategy & Evangelist, KnowBe4 Africa
item.description: Anna is currently SVP of Content Strategy & Evangelist for KnowBe4 Africa where she drives security awareness across the African continent. Collard founded security content publisher Popcorn Training, now part of KnowBe4, which is a South African company that promotes cybersecurity awareness by using innovative, story-based techniques and gamification to make complex content simple to understand and easy to remember.

item.title: Ep529: Jessica Richman | Trade and Investment Director, The Australian Trade Founder and CEO, The Visible Collective
item.description: Jessica Richman serves as a San Francisco-based Trade and Investment Director for The Australian Trade and Investment Commission. In this role, Jessica helps US-based tech companies launch and expand in Australia. She also assists Australian tech companies with their US expansion. Additionally, Jessica acts as Founder and CEO of The Visible Collective® where she advises companies on product development, marketing, and new business development to better serve customers labeled overweight or obese by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Ms. Richman previously held roles in marketing, growth and strategy at Walmart.com. One of her greatest achievements was a 10-month solo around-the-world trip.

item.title: Ep527: Rachel Diamant | Chief IP officer & Head of Pipeline Development, Emendo Biotherapeutics
item.description: Emendo was founded in 2015 by Rachel and a group of classmates from Weizmann. Her role at Emendo as Chief Intellectual Property Officer & Head of Pipeline Development includes building is to design an IP strategy for Emendo that both generates an extensive patent portfolio to cover various novel aspects of the technology and products and also navigates the IP space. Additionally, she is building Emendo’s pipeline of clinical programs and the academic and industrial collaborations and partnerships for the pre/clinical development of Emendo’s selected indications and genomic targets.

item.description: Tomer is the co-founder and Chief Product Officer of Gusto, a software company helping hundreds of thousands of businesses start, build and grow their teams. He's optimistic, easily excitable, chronically impatient, and a loving father of 3.

item.description:
Amitai is an experienced CEO, specializing in growing early-stage tech ventures from no revenue / early revenue to tens of millions in ARR across regions and verticals.
As Pentera CEO, he's led exponential growth since January 2018, to becoming the de-facto market leader in Automated Security Validation, through 3 funding rounds, from AWZ Ventures, The Blackstone Group, and Insight Partners, the most prominent cybersecurity investor of our times.

item.title: Ep524: Oded Hermoni | Managing Partner, J-Ventures VC fund
item.description: Oded is an investor, entrepreneur and journalist. Since 2005, he has invested in over 70 companies (5 of which became Unicorns), as is currently the Managing Partner and Co-Founder of the J-Ventures Fund (a "Capitalist Kibbutz") in Silicon Valley. Oded is active in philanthropic organizations and has been a Board Member at the Jewish Federation SF, JFCS, Friends of Hebrew University, ICON, Intro, and more.

item.title: Ep523: Amit Daniel | Chief Marketing Officer and Strategy, Cognyte
item.description: Amit Daniel is a Marketing leader with two decades of experience in global high-tech companies. Since joining the Cognyte business in 2015, Amit has been responsible for global marketing, employer brand, and demand generation for driving business growth. Prior to joining the Cognyte business, Amit was EVP Marketing and Products at cVidya (now an Amdocs company) and VP Marketing, Business Development and Products at Starhome (now TOMIA).

item.title: Ep522: Limor Segev | VP Product, Pecan
item.description: Limor is a proud mother of 4 and very happily married. She has over 18 years of experience in tech, last 11 years in product management in startups, eBay and WeWork. During her career, she was always attracted to data and ways to leverage it to make a business impact. Her last two roles before joining Pecan were eBay where she led the product team for the eBay catalog and in WeWork billing and payments. Today she leads Product at Pecan, with the mission to empower every data analyst to create business impact using ML and predictive analytics.

item.title: Ep521: Maor Farid | Postdoctoral Fulbright and ISEF Fellow, MIT
item.description: Dr. Farid is a lecturer and Fulbright scholar at the Technion and MIT, and a member of Harvard’s Leadership Program. He completed his Ph.D. with honors as the youngest graduate at the Technion at the age of 24, focusing on seismic protection of nuclear reactors. He served as a Captain and AI researcher in Unit 8200 and was acknowledged as an excellent Scientist (top 3 academics in the IDF). Farid is the founder and CEO of 'Lilmod Lehatsliach' (Hebrew: Learn to Succeed) – an NGO for empowering youth at risk from the Israeli periphery, and the author of the top seller “Learn to Succeed”.

item.title: Ep519: Dekel Persi | Co Founder and Managing Partner, TPY Capital
item.description: Dekel Persi is a founding partner at TPY Capital, an early-stage venture capital fund with over $135M under management. TPY Capital partners with both serial and first-time entrepreneurs seeking partners who share similar values and hands-on support. TPY Capital invested in more than 20 companies including AI21, UniPaaS, H2Pro, Qedma, Pasqal, Paramount Data, TabNine, Signals, Seebo and Enzymotec.

item.title: Ep520: Sreeram Ravinoothala | Director of R&D, VMWare
item.description: Sreeram is Director of R&D at VMWare a cloud computing and virtualization company. He runs an R&D team across Geos that provides connectivity and services for workloads that run on multi-clouds using NSX orchestrator or that works based on K8s orchestration. Sreeram has delivered products that help customers to focus on the workloads or apps than on the underlying infrastructure. Sreeram's focus has now been to look at SaaS-based infrastructure services in a multi-cloud scenario.

item.title: Ep518: Ziv Peled | Chief Customer Officer, AppsFlyer
item.description: Ziv knew he wanted to work in hi-tech since he was 13, he got closer and closer every summer break. Year after year people gave him a chance to do more and learn more, he hopes he's paying his debt today. In his 20+ years, he mostly worked customer-facing and he truly loves the relationship companies develop with their customers and the importance of it in B2B SaaS.

item.itunes:summary: Ziv knew he wanted to work in hi-tech since he was 13, he got closer and closer every summer break. Year after year people gave him a chance to do more and learn more, he hopes he's paying his debt today. In his 20+ years, he mostly worked customer-facing and he truly loves the relationship companies develop with their customers and the importance of it in B2B SaaS.

item.title: Ep517: Shimon Tolts | CEO & Co-Founder, Datree
item.description: Shimon established and managed the Software Engineering Infrastructure department for 400 engineers at ironSource. Also, as an AWS Community Hero, Shimon runs the largest AWS user group worldwide and is an avid speaker at conferences. Today, Shimon is the CEO & Co-Founder at Datree, an automated policy enforcement solution for Kubernetes. The CLI tool prevents Kubernetes misconfigurations by ensuring the manifests and Helm charts follow best practices, as well as your organization's policies.
item.dc:creator: Michael Matias

The CLI tool prevents Kubernetes misconfigurations by ensuring the manifests and Helm charts follow best practices, as well as your organization's policies.

item.title: Ep516: Tato Bigio | Co-Founder and CEO, UBQ Materials Ltd.
item.description: Co-Founder and CEO of UBQ Materials, Tato is redefining household waste as a valuable material feedstock for the manufacturing industry. Prior to UBQ, he co-founded and managed Merhav Renewable Energies (MRE), where he developed and implemented large-scale wind, solar, and bioethanol projects around the world. Before selling MRE in 2008, Tato served as the President and CEO of Ampal-American Israel Corporation, an investment company traded on both the NASDAQ and the Tel Aviv stock exchanges. A native of Lima-Peru, Bigio grew up in the shores of the Pacific Ocean with a passion for diving and sailing which he carries till today.

item.title: Ep514: Sonwabise Mzinyathi | Senior Manager: Global Policy and Government Affairs, Global Citizen
item.description: Sonwabise Mzinyathi started her career in diplomacy and was posted as a Diplomat for South Africa in New Delhi, India. She left diplomacy to join corporate and has worked for PR agencies, tech and FinTech companies including TBWA’s Magna Carta, Cisco, and Refinitiv - a London Stock Exchange Business. Currently, she is in the NGO space working for global advocacy NGO, Global Citizen. She also serves on several Boards and Committees including the SA Women in ICT Forum, Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment ICT Sector Council and the Cisco Charitable Foundation Trust and owns several companies. Her passion is using technology to address social ills.

item.title: Ep513: Shlomi Kofman | Consul General of Israel to the Pacific North-West
item.description: Consul General of Israel to the Pacific North-West, Mr Shlomi Kofman is a 25 years career diplomat with vast experience in diplomacy, tech relations, and public policy. Prior to his posting in San Francisco, Consul General Kofman served as served Policy Advisor to the Deputy Foreign Ministers, as Israel’s Deputy Consul General in New York City, Chief of Staff to Ambassadors in Washington D.C., Deputy Ambassador in Thailand, and Deputy Consul General in Shanghai.

item.title: Ep512: Ronen Luzon | Founder & CEO, My Size Inc.
item.description: Ronen is a serial entrepreneur and a skilled manager with a track record of success across various industries. Prior to founding MySize, he established and led startups in the medical devices and communication sectors. Among his other endeavors, Ronen founded Malers, a company that has grown to be a leader in the global security solutions market and provides some of the most advanced technological solutions for integrated communication infrastructures, security, and control systems. Prior to that, he held several senior marketing, sales management, and professional services positions in a variety of international high-tech companies. Ronen graduated from Middlesex University in London with a B.sc in IT and Business Information Systems.

item.title: Ep511: Eran Horowitz | CEO and Co-Founder, Credit24
item.description: Credit24 is a Fintech company, which aims to create a One-Stop-Shop for the online lending industry. The company has developed a turnkey solution, which allows fully automated underwriting, operation, and collection, alongside KYC and a sales\retention platform. The company uses a proprietary solution that allows partnerships with various companies, from insurance companies to retail giants to offer loans, credit lines, or POS payments, without the need to develop anything on their end nor setting up a call center. The company was established in 2016 by Eran Horowitz, Asaf Iofe, and Ziv Rossbach.

item.title: Ep510: Elnor Rozenrot | CEO, Jasper (formerly CreditStacks)
item.description: Elnor is the CEO and Co-Founder of the credit card company Jasper, formerly known as CreditStacks. Previously, Elnor was Co-Founder and CEO of mobile advertising platform Pingjam and VP of New Growth Platforms at LG Electronics. Elnor holds an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth and a Bachelor’s degree in Law from the Academic College of Law in Tel Aviv.

item.title: Ep509: Melissa Slaymaker | Women in Tech Country Director for South Africa
item.description: Melissa is a speaker, moderator, and advocate for Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace and helps to empower women through connecting them to various programs, events, and opportunities - created to give access to investors, mentors, networking, quality education, or job opportunities.

item.title: Ep508: Miki Shifman | Co-Founder and CTO, Cylus
item.description: Miki Shifman is the CTO and co-founder of Cylus, which provides cybersecurity solutions for the rail industry. Miki is a veteran leader in the development of complex cyber security projects, with over ten years of experience in software engineering, research, and management. Prior to co-founding Cylus, Miki served as an R&D leader in the Cyber R&D Division of the Israel Defense Force’s Elite Technological Unit. He led teams awarded the Israel Defense Prize for exceptional technological breakthroughs and received high military honors for extraordinary achievement and exceptional contributions to national security. Miki has been recognized as an expert for Smart Mobility and Cyber Security by the World Economic Forum and he was featured on the Forbes “30 Under 30” list of 2020.

item.title: Ep507: Aviv Ben Arie | Staff Data Scientist, Intuit
item.description: Aviv is a Staff Data Scientist at Intuit, previously a Lead Data Scientist at PayPal. She specializes in fraud prevention and cybersecurity, and in the past worked at the Prime Minister’s Office in the Cyber Security field, focusing on protocol analysis. Aviv graduated from Tel Aviv University with a double BSc in Computer Science and Life Science, while specializing in Bioinformatics.

item.title: Ep506: John Rossman | Author, The Amazon Way Managing Partner, Rossman Partners
item.description: John Rossman is the author of The Amazon Way book series, a former Amazon leader and Managing Partner at Rossman Partners. John is an expert leveraging the Amazon leadership principles to help others innovate, compete and win in the digital era. John was an executive at Amazon.com where he played a key role in launching the Amazon marketplace business as the Director of Merchant Integration and went on to have responsibilities for the enterprise business at Amazon.

item.title: Ep505: Omri Lavie | Co-Founder & CEO, Orchestra Group
item.description: Omri Lavie is a serial entrepreneur and an Angel investor. He co-founded NSO Group and is the co-founder and CEO of Orchestra Group, a holistic cybersecurity platform for proactive cyber defense. Omri founded several technology companies in various fields, specializing in Enterprise SW, Telecom, Cyber Intelligence & Cyber Security. He is also the co-founder at Founders Group, a private investment firm that invests in early-stage startups. He is an active philanthropist continuously supporting numerous non-profits in education, cancer wellness, the elderly, and child care.

item.title: Ep504: Hanna Yanovsky | GM & CRO (Chief Revenue Officer), Caja Robotics
item.description: Hannah started as a commercial lawyer advising and managing transactions in the tech ecosystem. Her curiosity led her to change sides and become an entrepreneur and tech executive, and since 2015 has been focusing on the Robotics and Automation industries. She is the General Manager and Chief Revenue Officer of Caja Robotics, automating solutions for order fulfillment.

item.title: Ep503: Yael Benjamin | Founder, Y.Benjamin Strategic Marketing
item.description: Yael is the founder of Startup Snapshot, a data-sharing platform working to increase transparency in the startup ecosystem. Former investment banker turned strategic advisor to innovators, she is on a mission to bring the same level of analysis she saw in the corporate world to startups, but in the flexible timeframe and formats that they need. With over a decade of experience in the industry, she has worked with hundreds of startups, helping them raise over $1B (and counting).

item.title: Ep502: Shahar Peled | CEO, Eternity
item.description: Shahar is an Israeli Entrepreneur based in Tel Aviv, Israel. He's the CEO of Eternity, a post-investment Israeli startup established to change the way people commemorate and celebrate the life stories of their loved ones in a respectful, accessible, and moving way. Shahar majored in Business and Data Science at IDC and graduated with honors. His managerial approach is "all-around", hands-on involvement, the idea to execution process, and data-driven decision making.

item.title: Ep501: Tony Zorc | CEO & Founder, Accounting Seed
item.description: Tony is an Iconoclast, Founder, and CEO of Accounting Seed, technology entrepreneur, ForbesBooks author, and CPA for 20+ years. He embodies iconoclasm, the idea of challenging the prescribed way of doing things and coming up with a better, more innovative solution. Accounting Seed – the world’s first accounting platform – is disrupting the cloud accounting industry and has over one thousand customers and fourteen thousand users, and has sustained double-digit growth for over ten consecutive years.

item.title: Ep500: Myra Khanna | Founder & CEO, Sama
item.description: Myra founded Sama to make the power of excellent executive coaching available to all employees. She trained as an M&A lawyer, but spent most of her career as an investor in private equity and venture capital at PSP Investments and BCI, large institutional asset managers, investing billions globally. She benefited from coaching in her career and believes that it is the best way to unlock potential in people and live a life of purpose.

item.title: Ep499: Kyle Lacy | Chief Marketing Officer, Lessonly
item.description: Kyle Lacy brings over 14 years of experience in marketing with a slice of revenue. He is currently Chief Marketing Officer at Lessonly. Prior to joining Lessonly, Kyle held senior positions at OpenView, Salesforce and ExactTarget. He is also the author of three books, Twitter Marketing for Dummies, Branding Yourself and Social CRM for Dummies. He wears monotone, loves history and hates onions.

item.title: Ep498: Michael Shaulov | CEO, Fireblocks
item.description: Michael is the CEO and co-founder of Fireblocks, a secure digital asset infrastructure company. Prior to Fireblocks, he co-founded Lacoon Mobile Security, which was acquired by Check Point, and was then appointed the Head of Products, Mobile and Cloud Security for Check Point. Michael is a serial cybersecurity entrepreneur and investor. He is also a recognized industry speaker, delivering talks at RSA Conference, BlackHat and Infosec.

item.title: Ep497: Claudelle von Eck | Founder, Brave Inflexions
item.description: A former CEO of the Institute of Internal Auditors SA, Dr Claudelle is the founder of Brave Inflexions. Her practice focuses on leadership, governance, change management, ethics, culture and whistleblower support. Her approach is transformative with an emphasis on purpose and empowerment. She is an experienced executive and non-executive director and has served on numerous international committees and task teams. She holds a Master’s in Business Leadership and her doctoral degree is in leadership with a particular focus on change management.

item.title: Ep496: Sharel Omer | CEO & Co-Founder, Affogata.com
item.description: Sharel Omer is an Israeli entrepreneur whose passion for personal connections and building relationships has made him dedicated to bringing the consumer voice's power to brands and organizations. He's the CEO & Co-Founder of Affogata, a leading Consumer Intelligence Platform that enables brands to be truly customer-obsessed by bringing their customers' voices to the right teams in the organization. Affogata's portfolio of clients includes names like Wix.com, Fiverr, Lemonade, eToro, MyHeritage, Plarium, and more.

item.title: Ep495: Jillian Goldberg | VP of Marketing and Investor Relations, GuardKnox
item.description: Jillian is the current VP of Marketing and Investor Relations at GuardKnox Cyber Technologies, a world-leading Autotech company and the automotive industry’s first Cybertech Tier, where she was also one of the first employees. Originally from Cincinnati Ohio, she completed her undergraduate work at Tulane University before joining Teach for America as an inner-city high physics and chemistry teacher. She is a mentor in the flagship program through Women in Mobility, an Expert at Quantum Hub Accelerator, Competitive Powerlifter and Crossfitter, Advisor to the Alexander Muss High School in Israel for Entrepreneurship, among others.

item.description: Raz Bachar is the Global Lead for Startup Emerging Technologies & Managing Director - Israel at Microsoft For Startups. He is a business development professional and strategist, in generating growth for tech services and products. Before Microsoft, Raz built and drove the growth of AWS across several startup ecosystems in Europe, Middle East, and Africa through strategic planning, community building, and partnerships with VCs and accelerators.

item.description: With 15 years of cross-sector experience in founding, managing and directing private and public companies in the tech and Cannabis industries, Omer has been leading M&A processes, global strategic partnerships, and deal-making worldwide. Omer has also been teaching as a senior lecturer in various academic institutes, both for Computer Science and for Behavioral Sciences, with a specialization in Cannabis.

item.title: Ep493: Dmitry Geyzersky | CTO and Founder, Click-Ins Ltd.
item.description: Dmitry Geyzersky is a software architect and technology consultant with a proven record of building military-grade intelligence systems. As the Co-founder & CTO of Click-Ins, he has two patents pending and his fields of research include ontology, domain-driven design, graph technologies, link analysis, computer vision, and artificial intelligence. Dima has created companies and worked with a wide range of customers from startup companies to government organizations. He holds a B.Sc degree in Economics and Information Systems Engineering from the Technion Institute of Technology.

item.title: Ep491: Ofer Sinai | Co Founder, HopOn
item.description: HopOn is the pioneer app for transit payments in Israel. It serves more than 1M users a month who use our services for navigating and paying through their commute on buses, trains and big taxis. HopOn today has a presence in 5 different countries, which include (Russia, Germany, Czech Republic, UK and Israel). it was founded in 2013 by Ofer Sinai, while he was taking his daily commute from Petah Tikva towards the KPMG office in Tel Aviv.

item.title: Ep490: Zviki Ben-Ishay | Co-Founder & CEO, Lightico
item.description: Zviki founded Lightico to empower businesses to effectively sell and service customers completely in the first call. Zviki is an expert in contact center management technologies in the field of innovation and analytics. His experiences in contact center management and technologies have sharpened his industry knowledge and his innovations have impacted millions of customer interactions. Prior to Lightico, Zviki led product innovation and deployment across leading CX companies including Nice Systems (NASDAQ), Netcom and Exbee (Cisco solution).

item.title: Ep489: Eli Israelov | Co-Founder & CEO, CommBox
item.description: Eli can't sleep at night (literally) when an idea is bumped into his mind. He won't relax until he materializes it. He is an entrepreneur since he can remember himself, and raised money for his first startup when he was a cab driver on a ride from Jaffa to Ramat Aviv.

item.title: Ep488: Madison Campbell | CEO, Leda Health
item.description: Madison Campbell is a trailblazer and sexual assault advocate. After going to college to study epidemiology in space populations, Madison has become a well-seasoned entrepreneur. She led a company prior to Leda Health called “Iyanu,” which was a software development shop based in Lagos, Nigeria. Today, she is working hard to promote the autonomy and self-actualization of sexual assault survivors through Leda Health by developing and providing resources to help them overcome their difficult trauma.

item.title: Ep487: Tomer Levy | CEO and co-founder, Logz.io
item.description: Tomer is the CEO and co-founder of Logz.io. Before founding Logz.io, he co-founded and was the CTO of Intigua, a company that developed innovative, Docker-like containers designed for large enterprises. Prior to Intigua, Tomer spent six years at CheckPoint, where he led its Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) product from concept to market, generating $100M in revenue in the second year. Tomer has an M.B.A. from Tel Aviv University and a B.A. in computer science.

Tomer has an M.B.A. from Tel Aviv University and a B.A. in computer science.

item.title: Ep486: Suzan Zaher Kamal | Software Developer & Team Lead, CodeValue
item.description: Suzan is a 26 years old Druze Israeli married woman, a software developer and a team lead in the hi-tech industry in CodeValue. She is working on a project of a complex imagery analysis system, integrating solutions for presenting a big amount of 2D and 3D imagery data on web platforms, and seeking to be an influencer in the tech industry.

item.title: Ep485: Dave Harden | Democratic Candidate For Congress, MD 1st
item.description: Dave Harden is the Managing Director of the Georgetown Strategy Group, ​a Washington, D.C. next-generation firm that leverages talent, technology, and capital to help solve some of the world's most complex problems. In May of 2019, President Trump awarded Mr. Harden the Presidential Award for Distinguished Service, the highest award in the Foreign Service, for “sustained extraordinary accomplishment in the conduct of the foreign policy.” He led a bureau focused on global crisis response and political transition with an annual budget of $4.8 billion and a staff of nearly 1,200. He also spearheaded all USAID efforts to respond to global crises and stabilization efforts – including responses in Haiti, Iraq, Somalia, South Sudan, Syria, the West Bank/Gaza, and Yemen.

item.title: Ep484: Elram Goren | Co-Founder & CEO, Fabric
item.description:
Elram Goren is CEO and co-founder of Fabric, a micro-fulfillment company building on-demand fulfillment and customer experience solutions for retailers. He has led the company from its inception in 2015 through its first deployments and now is at the helm of its rapidly scaling operations.

Before co-founding Fabric, Elram served as a Major in the Israeli Defence Forces managing R&D teams and multidisciplinary operations in the Intelligence Technology Unit. He is a graduate of the elite Psagot Excellence Program.

item.title: Ep483: Yaron Bartal | VP Growth, SciPlay Corporation
item.description: Yaron's interest in marketing began 15 years ago while researching a McDonald's case study. In 2010 he joined Matomy and four years later founded his own company with two great friends. He later joined Apester and spearheaded the entire business and media operations. He recently joined Sciplay, a social gaming behemoth, as VP Growth and is looking after their global marketing efforts starting from organic and paid user acquisition to marketing tech, art, and innovation.

item.title: Ep482: Sabina Iman | Founder, Blink
item.description: Sabina is a strategist with eleven years of marketing and sales experience and a master’s degree in Business Administration focusing on tech and entrepreneurship. Her previous experience includes working at Omnicom Group with large companies such as Visa, McDonald's and Wrigley. After completing her MBA, Sabina was consulting B2B tech startups. Recently she founded her own company that is aimed to change online dating habits and create a new dating experience for women.

item.title: Ep480: Yair Kuznitsov | Co-Founder & CEO, anecdotes
item.description: After building and managing teams in different places in the IDF Intelligence Corps, I was head of the hardcore R&D section at 8200. I then took a giant risk and built a new SaaS product for Intsights, hoping I’d quickly adapt to the modern tech stack and it turned out to be very successful. I started anecdotes with two friends, Roi and Eitan, and we currently have 30 employees in Tel Aviv. Transforming from R&D Manager to CEO means managing Marketing and Sales, which is another big move. But it seems like it’s working so far because modern R&D and modern M&S departments actually are very similar.

item.description: Tami's expertise is in driving change and supporting organizations through massive growth and transformation by partnering with leaders, teams, and employees to think through business problems and collaboratively move the businesses forward.

item.title: Ep478: Urit Lanzet | Cyber Security Pre-sales Engineer & BizDev, CYMOTIVE Technologies
item.description: Urit is originally a low-level security researcher from 49 center in 8200. She has been working in CYMOTIVE since its earlier days as Diskin Advanced Technologies, and among her roles in the company, she served as a Penetration Testing team leader. She is currently leading new opportunities with automotive industry clients from Europe and the USA and supporting the incubation of innovative product ideas inside the company. Her passions include understanding how things work and making them work better. She like understanding motives and seeing through the "outer shell" of either people, animals, and businesses.

item.title: Ep479: Jeff Kupietzky | CEO, Jeeng
item.description: Jeff serves as CEO of Jeeng, an innovative technology company helping publishers bring their audiences back.  Before joining Jeeng, Jeff was President & CEO at Oversee.net and served in leadership positions with X1 Technologies, Digital Insight (Intuit), Siebel Systems (Oracle), Loudcloud/ Opsware (Hewlett-Packard), and McKinsey & Co. A frequent speaker at Digital Media conferences, he has also been featured on CNN & CNBC. Jeff earned an MBA at Harvard Business School and his B.A. in Economics from Columbia University.

item.title: Ep477: Ofer Schreiber | Partner and Head of Israel Office, YL Ventures
item.description: Ofer Schreiber, Partner, and Head of Israel Office at YL Ventures have broad responsibilities across the firm’s portfolio company management, value-add activities, and investment due diligence. Prior to joining YL Ventures, Ofer spent three years at IVC Research Center researching and analyzing the technology and venture capital industry. He also served in the elite technological unit of IDF, Unit 8200. Ofer regularly speaks, writes, and features in interviews about the state of the cybersecurity industry, investment strategies, start-up development, and Israeli cybersecurity innovation.

item.title: Ep475: Yinnon Dolev | CEO, Sompo Digital Lab Israel, Sompo Holdings
item.description: Yinnon is the CEO of Sompo’s Digital Lab in Tel Aviv. Sompo is Japan’s largest insurance company which also operates a chain of nursing homes for the elderly. His group is responsible for partnering and investing in startups in areas such as Insurtech, Digital Health, Smart Mobility, and Agritech. Prior to that, Yinnon spent 13 years at General Electric (GE) in various management positions. He established GE's company’s startups partnership program, which included 26 startups. Yinnon holds a BA in Computer Science from the Interdisciplinary Center in Israel an MBA from Cornell University.

item.title: Ep472: Michael Shoham | CEO, Radix
item.description: Michael brings with him more than 20 years of experience in business development and a deep understanding of technology. He is passionate about technology, sport, music, and art, especially woodcraft and clay sculpture. Michael holds a BSc from Bar-Ilan University and an MBA from Derby University. He is a loving husband (married to Michal, a Physiotherapist) and a proud father of 4 daughters.

item.title: Ep471: Zachary Mannheimer | CEO and founder of Alquist
item.description: Zachary Mannheimer is the CEO and founder of Alquist, a 3D printing construction company that uses cutting-edge technology to create houses, buildings, and other structures aimed at dropping the cost of homes and solving the housing crisis. After a road trip from NYC to 22 cities around the country, Zachary chose and settled in Des Moines in 2007 founding the Des Moines Social Club, an art and educational non-profit. In 11 years of operations, DMSC hosted over 10,000 events for over 1,000,000 patrons. In 2020, Zachary co-founded Atlas Community Studios, a team helping rural communities plan for growth in over 20 states, where the main concern is housing. He lives in Iowa City with his wife Sarah, and their three kids Mira, Benjamin, and Fiona.

item.title: Ep512: Ronen Luzon | Founder & CEO, My Size Inc.
item.description: Ronen is a serial entrepreneur and a skilled manager with a track record of success across various industries. Prior to founding MySize, he established and led startups in the medical devices and communication sectors. Among his other endeavors, Ronen founded Malers, a company that has grown to be a leader in the global security solutions market and provides some of the most advanced technological solutions for integrated communication infrastructures, security, and control systems. Prior to that, he held several senior marketing, sales management, and professional services positions in a variety of international high-tech companies. Ronen graduated from Middlesex University in London with a B.sc in IT and Business Information Systems.

item.title: Ep470: Ori Yankelev | Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) and founding team member, OwnBackup
item.description: Ori Yankelev is the Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) and founding team member of OwnBackup where he leads the company's global go-to-market strategy. Based in Tel Aviv, Ori led the expansion of OwnBackup’s global sales organization from 1 employee to what is today over 200 employees globally with a presence in the US, UK, France, Israel, and Australia.

item.title: Ep469: Ana Bas Lapique and Belén De Jaime | Co-Founders, Flipeat
item.description: We are Belen and Ana, two very enthusiastic 25-year-old friends from childhood with previous experience in banking, consulting and Amazon, who always knew wanted to create a business together. We co-founded Flipeat 6 months ago with the aim of creating a more efficient restaurant reservation process through digitalization, adding a social component that allows creating a personalized network of friends to share culinary experiences and recommendations. We are present in Madrid and soon to open Barcelona and Marbella, but we aim to expand internationally in the upcoming year.

item.title: Ep468: Itamar Ben Hemo | Co-Founder and CEO, Rivery
item.description: Itamar Ben Hamo is co-founder and CEO at Rivery, a DataOps platform that streamlines data integration, transformation, and orchestration. A seasoned business executive, Ben Hamo was co-founder and CEO of Vision.BI, a leading data consulting firm acquired by Keyrus Group. At Keyrus, Ben Hamo was group vice president for North America. Itamar holds a BSc in Computer and Information Systems Security from Ben Gurion University of the Negev.

item.title: Ep467: Chemi Katz | Co-founder and CEO, Namogoo
item.description: Chemi Katz is the current CEO and Co-Founder of Namogoo, a Digital Journey Continuity platform serving over 250 global brands in eCommerce. With over 17 years of experience in the eCommerce, security, commerce, and advertising spaces, Chemi is an experienced visionary and serial entrepreneur who builds disruptive technologies. Prior to co-founding Namogoo, Chemi was General Manager of DoubleVerify Israel and co-founded Seapai and Reissod. Earlier in his career, Chemi led Production Operations at LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN), was Global Business Technology Manager for Aladdin, and managed IT Outsourcing for Bynet.

item.title: Ep466: Michael Eisenberg | Equal Partner, Aleph VC
item.description: Michael Eisenberg is an Equal Partner at Aleph, an early-stage venture capital fund with over $500M under management. Since its founding in 2013, Aleph has invested in more than 40 companies including Melio, Lemonade, Bringg, JoyTunes, Healthy.io, and Nexar.

item.title: Ep465: Dana Zelitzki | VP of Marketing, Valens
item.description: With more than 10 years of experience in the hi-tech industry in various business development, marketing, and product management roles, Dana is responsible for the Valens’ marketing activities. Dana leads the company’s messaging, positioning, go-to-market, and general marketing activities, including communications, tradeshows, media, digital marketing, and more. Dana has contributed to building the Valens and HDBaseT brands and establishing the company’s leadership in both the audio-video and automotive markets.

item.title: Ep464: Yonatan Geifman | Co-founder and CEO of Deci
item.description: Yonatan is co-founder and CEO of Deci, the deep learning company building the next generation of AI. He co-founded Deci after completing his Ph.D. in computer science at the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology. His research focused on making Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) more applicable for mission-critical tasks. Yonatan was also a member of Google AI’s MorphNet team where he worked on developing an automated machine learning algorithm based on neural network pruning.

item.title: Ep463: Gadi Gidor | Artistic Director and Career Manager
item.description: Gadi was born in Israel right before they put a man on the moon. He Moved to NY upon completing his three years of mandatory military service and graduated with a Bachelor's degree from NYU (Stern school of business) as well as with an MBA degree from Harvard University. He had been working his entire professional life in the music industry, assuming various roles in Major Record companies. Currently, he is enjoying his independence as a freelance artists' manager/consultant. Gadi is married to Yuri Kato and is the father of Yasmin, Lia, and Eden.

Prior to Viola Omry was a Senior Vice President at Goldman Sachs in the tech, media, and telecom (TMT) investment banking group. Omry’s areas of investment at Viola Ventures include FinTech and insruTech as well as Enterprise and SME Software.

item.title: Ep460: Ofir Bar Levav | Chief Business Officer, Indoor Robotics
item.description: Ofir started his career in Procter & Gamble where he spent 12 years in various management roles in Finance, strategy, BD, and M&A working on many P&G brands (Pampers, Haircare, Gillette, etc) and including 2 relocations periods in Europe (Belgium, Switzerland). He moved to Tyco running finance for the security products division and later on BD & M&A for the division. He joined Johnson Controls as it acquired Tyco and was the general manager for the global open innovation platform. A year ago he joined Indoor Robotics as Chief Business Officer. Ofir also serves as a venture advisor at Spider Capital.

item.title: Ep459: Yariv Bash | Co-founder and CEO, Flytrex, Founder, SpaceIL
item.description: Yariv Bash is the CEO and co-founder of Flytrex, a drone technology company providing comprehensive, autonomous drone delivery solutions that enable any business, from SMBs to e-commerce giants, to integrate instant, autonomous drone delivery into their offering. Flytrex is an end-to-end drone logistics solution spearheading the drone revolution. Prior to Flytrex, Yariv was the Founder and CEO of SpaceIL, a $100M Israeli non-profit organization that attempted to land Beresheet, the first private interplanetary robotic mission, on the Moon.

item.title: Ep458: Song Toh | VP of Product Management, Tata Communications
item.description: Song is the VP of Product Management at Tata Communications, a global telecommunications managed service provider. He runs a global business connecting the offices and users of multinational enterprises, to their critical business applications, using the latest programmable network and IT infrastructure technology.  At global companies like Cisco and Tata Communications, Song has delivered products that make enterprise IT infrastructure more agile, cost efficient and easy to use, allowing my customers to focus on their business, rather than constrained by the complex technologies they deploy.

item.title: Ep457: Yossi Naar | Chief visionary officer and Co-founder, Cybereason
item.description: Yossi Naar, Chief Visionary Officer and Co-Founder of Cybereason -  a leader in EDR and next-generation antivirus solutions for enterprises. Yossi is an accomplished software developer and expert in technology architecture, machine learning, big data analytics, and visualization. During his 20 years of industry experience, Yossi has designed and built many products, from cutting-edge security platforms for the defense industry in Israel to big data platforms. His products have been deployed worldwide and used by Fortune-500 companies on a daily basis. Since he founded Cybereason in 2012 the company raised almost $400 million from investors like Softbank, Lockheed Martin, CRV, and Spark Capital. Cybereason is privately held with 700 employees, operates in 40 countries, and headquartered in Boston with offices in London, Tel Aviv, and Tokyo.

item.title: Ep454: Avishay Cohen | Co-founder & CEO, Anima
item.description: Avishay Cohen is the Co-founder & CEO at Anima. After leading multiple tech teams, Avishay had the first-hand experience of the difficulties in the handoff process between design and development. That’s why he started Anima - a design-to-code platform. Allowing designers to create responsive prototypes from inside their designs tool, and translate these designs into developer-friendly React/HTML code.

item.title: Ep452: Sandeep Aggarwal | Founder, Droom & ShopClues
item.description: Sandeep Aggarwal is the only Indian technology founder who's created two Unicorns back-to-back – Droom, India’s first online automobile marketplace, and ShopClues, India’s first-ever managed online marketplace. Before his journey into entrepreneurship, he was a former top Wall Street tech analyst in the US who worked with Microsoft and Charles Schwab. During that time, he was often sought as an expert source on TV networks like CNBC. Insider trading charges (later dropped) derailed his life, but he fought through the adversity and never stopped fighting for what he believes.

item.title: Ep451: Amy Francetic | Founder and Managing General Partner, Buoyant Ventures
item.description: Amy is the founder and Managing General Partner of Buoyant Ventures, a new venture fund in Chicago that aims to invest in digital climate solutions. Her career spans over 20 years of high technology entrepreneurship, private equity, and research. Amy previously founded and led Energize Ventures, a venture fund that invests in digital energy and industrial automation. She also co-founded and served as CEO of technology accelerator Clean Energy Trust, which has invested in dozens of early-stage clean energy companies across the Midwestern US.

item.title: Ep450: Yoni Tserruya | Co-founder & CEO, Lusha
item.description: As Lusha’s co-founder and CEO, Yoni first developed Lusha as a side-project, during his first job as an iOs developer. After one year, his pet project exploded, and he decided to turn his passion into his profession. Today, Yoni helps create the vision and strategy that informs all product and business decisions at Lusha. He focuses on hiring the right team, anticipating the future needs of customers, and envisioning the future of the data world. A software engineer by trade, Yoni graduated with a BSC from Ben Gurion University.

item.title: Ep447: Christopher Coultas | Vice President of Product Innovation and Senior Leadership Consultant, Leadership Worth Following, LLC.
item.description: Christopher Coultas is the Vice President of Product Innovation and a Senior Leadership Consultant at Leadership Worth Following, LLC. He personifies the scientist-practitioner model in the fast-growing field of industrial-organizational psychology. He has coached hundreds of leaders and dozens of teams on how to leverage enhanced self-awareness for optimal leadership impact. His book with Leadership Worth Following, Driven Not Drained: Discover Your Path to Career Happiness, Effectiveness, and Influence is a candid, engaging, and comprehensive look at both the science and practical application behind human behavior.

item.title: Ep446: Haim Carmel | Chief Technology Officer, HomeConnex
item.description: From my early days of programming, I was an entrepreneur and a software company owner. I finished my computer science bachelor's degree in 1999. since then, I've participated in many big projects for government offices, private sector companies and even sold one of them to a huge software company in the states. Nowadays I'm the head of the R&D  department at HomeConnex, a startup that was founded in 2015 as an idea to help to develop the low tech construction and building market. With great success, we already have thousands of users and most of the big construction companies in Israel are working with us.

item.title: Ep445: Jason Sundby | CEO/Chairman, Verde Technologies Partner, Atlas Capital Partners
item.description: Since 2015, Jason has served as CEO of Verde Environmental Technologies Inc., maker of the Deterra® Drug Deactivation and Disposal System. He has over 30 years of experience in operations, risk management, administration, and IT leadership. Sundby is a founding partner of Atlas Capital Partners, a venture capital firm investing in companies that are post-revenue, on the verge of rapid growth, and possessing a defensible competitive advantage. Sundby completed his undergraduate studies at the University of Minnesota and continued his education at the Harvard School of Public Health and the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

item.title: Ep443: Gal Oz | CTO & Co-Founder, Pixellot
item.description: Gal is the Co-Founder and CTO of Pixellot, the world-leading company of fully autonomous video and data production for sports events. Pixellot produces a new game around the globe every 30 seconds! He served for 10 years with an elite R&D unit in the Intelligence Corps of the IDF, during which Gal worked with a different visual platform to capture information, from UAV to satellites. Prior he was in the founding group of SportVU and served as the CEO and R&D Manager of the company until it was sold to a US-based company, STATS, in 2008.

item.title: Ep441: Raj De Datta | Co-Founder and CEO, BloomReach
item.description: Raj De Datta is Co-Founder and CEO of BloomReach, a leading software platform for digital commerce experiences that powers brands representing 25% of retail E-Commerce in the US and the UK.   Raj is a multiple-time entrepreneur.  Before launching Bloomreach, he was entrepreneur-in-residence at Mohr-Davidow Ventures, served as Cisco’s director of product marketing, and was on the founding team of telecom company FirstMark Communications. Raj also worked in technology investment banking at Lazard Freres. Raj serves on the Council for Player Development for the US Tennis Association, as a Founder Partner at seed-stage venture capital firm Founder Collective and an individual investor in over 20 start-ups.  He holds a BS in Electrical Engineering with a certificate in Public Policy and International affairs from Princeton University and an MBA with distinction from Harvard Business School.

item.title: Ep439: Isabelle Kenyon | Founder & CEO, Calibrate
item.description: Isabelle is the Founder & CEO of Calibrate. Prior to Calibrate, she led the business operations, growth, and strategic partnerships & communications teams at Capsule, a technology business that has raised $270 million to rebuild the pharmacy from the inside out. Before Capsule, Isabelle worked at beloved consumer brands in London and New York and was selected to the Forbes 30 Under 30 Retail & E-commerce list in 2015. She began her career as an investment banker in Hong Kong and graduated from the University of Pennsylvania.

item.title: Ep435: Adi Diner | Co-Founder, CEO, iFocus
item.description:
Adi Diner is the CEO and co-founder of iFocus, she is a physicist (Ph.D.) with extensive experience in product development in the biotech and medical device industries.
1 in 10 children and adults have ADHD, today- the treatment relies only on subjective feedback- "do you feel it is working" as a result, many do not get treated properly. 
iFocus will change the way ADHD is treated by providing objective treatment efficacy measures.

item.title: Ep434: Kathy Henrich | CEO, Milwaukee Tech Hub Coalition
item.description: Kathy is the CEO of the MKE Tech Hub Coalition, a non-profit focused on inclusively doubling tech talent in the Milwaukee region with over 75 members. item.title: Ep431: Tal Florentin | CEO, Summurai
item.description: For the last decade, Tal Florentin has been one of the leading UX specialists in the Israeli market. Florentin is a published author, speaker, winner of the UX award (San Francisco), and founder of the Israeli UX certification program. After leading more than 180 UX design projects for fortunate - 100 companies - it became clear to him that audio is going to be bigger than video. Florentin founded Summurai – the world’s first branded audio CMS – with the promise to allow busy people to know more with less effort. Summurai allows companies to create branded audio channels, add branded audio content to their customer journeys and promote audio marketing.

item.description:

item.title: Ep427: Tigran Nazaryan | Co-founder & CEO, 10Web.io
item.description: Tigran Nazaryan is the Co-Founder and CEO at 10Web. With a strong background in science and technology, Tigran has vast hands-on experience in software development, machine learning, and bringing AI automation into web development, technologies that can help millions of engineers and designers focus on truly creative and important elements and leave routine and time-consuming tasks to algorithms. He is passionate about building a strong company culture that turns great ideas into powerful technological achievements and at the same time empathizes with the community. With the vision of automaton, he puts his best to lead 10Web's team of 70 professionals on the way to become a unicor.

item.itunes:summary: Tigran Nazaryan is the Co-Founder and CEO at 10Web. With a strong background in science and technology, Tigran has vast hands-on experience in software development, machine learning, and bringing AI automation into web development, technologies that can help millions of engineers and designers focus on truly creative and important elements and leave routine and time-consuming tasks to algorithms. He is passionate about building a strong company culture that turns great ideas into powerful technological achievements and at the same time empathizes with the community. With the vision of automaton, he puts his best to lead 10Web's team of 70 professionals on the way to become a unicor.

item.title: Ep426: Avi Shabtai | CEO, Ramon.Space
item.description: Avi is the CEO of Ramon.Space, a leader in space computing solutions. A seasoned leader, Avi has worked extensively to develop and manage teams, transform organizations into successful environments across multiple industries. Avi’s track record spans over two decades of international experience in business and technology leadership, marketing, strategic sales, channel development, and engineering.  Prior to Ramon.Space, Avi was CEO of MultiPhy Inc, specializing in high-speed integrated circuits for the data center market. He also held senior positions at Alvarion Technologies Metalink, Tiaris, and the Intelligence Unit of the Israeli Defense Force.

item.title: Ep425: Dionis Teshler | CTO & Co-Founder, GuardKnox Cyber Technologies
item.description: Dionis Teshler, Chief Technology Officer of the automotive industry’s first Cybertech Tier supplier, GuardKnox, is one of the central figures propelling Israel forward in the sector. In 2016 Dionis merged his aviation technology experience and his lifelong passion for driving fast cars into producing the cyber technology that serves as the foundation for software-defined and service-oriented vehicles. Prior to this, Dionis worked as an Algorithms Engineer for image-processing startup Transchip, which was acquired by Samsung Electronics. Dionis holds an M.Sc. in Computer Science (thesis in Computational Neuroscience, Cum Laude) and a Global MBA with a focus on Global Strategy from the Interdisciplinary Center of Herzliya.

item.title: Ep424: Roey Mechrez | CTO, BeyondMinds
item.description: As a leading AI pioneer and global visionary with extensive innovation experience in various industries, Dr. Mechrez co-founded BeyondMinds to bridge AI theory to practice, with the vision to create the first enterprise AI system that is universally applicable and easily adaptable. He is passionate about fostering a data-driven culture, using AI as a transformational catalyst to address complex regulatory, operational, and business intelligence challenges. Before founding BeyondMinds, Dr. Mechrez held a number of positions in hi-tech companies and academia and conducted research focused on the intersection of computer vision and deep learning.

item.title: Ep423: Sarah Wood | Co-founder and former CEO, Unruly Author, Stepping Up
item.description: Sarah Wood is the Co-founder and former CEO of Unruly, and author of the best-selling career book Stepping Up. She is an active angel investor in early-stage tech companies, a mentor at UCL Hatchery, and a board member at Tech Nation, City Ventures, and The Anna Freud National Centre for Children and Families, which campaigns for young people's mental health. Sarah is an ambassador for The Prince's Trust Women Supporting Women Programme and was awarded an OBE for services to technology and innovation.

item.title: Ep422: Paul Bilodeau | CEO and Founder, Filtered.AI
item.description: Paul Bilodeau is the CEO and founder of Filtered, a capabilities-based hiring platform designed specifically for engineers, developers, and tech talent, that helps to remove unconscious bias from the hiring process through assessments and coding tasks. Paul started his professional career as a recruiter for a leading recruitment firm in Boston. It wasn’t long before he identified major disconnects and inefficiencies when it came to the hiring process, so in 2010 he created PangeaConnect, a video interviewing platform. Soon after, he co-founded a data science consulting company refactorED, and built Filtered as an internal tool to ensure candidate authentication and more accurately assess candidates’ technical skills. In 2018, the demand to license Filtered as a standalone product led to the establishment of Filtered, Inc. and the continued drive to radically change the hiring process.

item.title: Ep421: Kfir Oved | Founder and CEO, Canopy Immuno-therapeutics
item.description: Kfir has a dual background in Medicine and a Ph.D. in Immunology. He is a serial bio-entrepreneur with an endless passion for outcome-driven, personalized, technology-agnostic Medicine. Co-founder, CTO, and Chairman of MeMed Dx that translates our immune response signals into accurate and actionable diagnostics at the point of care. Seeded and serves as Chief Strategy in Navina.ai, and recently founded and serves as the CEO of Canopy Immuno-Therapeutics.

item.title: Ep420: Andrew Bach | Global Financial Technologies leader
item.description: With over 30 years of experience, Andy specializes in network/telecommunications, security, and financial technologies.  Andy has substantial expertise to lead strategic communication technological planning to achieve business goals by prioritizing technology initiatives and coordinating the evaluation, deployment, and management of current and future technologies.  As a Global Financial Technologies leader, I establish strategic direction, lead all aspects of technology development and implementation, and provide formal supervision and coaching for the Architectural, Security, and Infrastructure functions while setting the vision to inspire and drive continuous improvements

item.title: Ep419: Colin Hunter | CEO and Founder, PotentialSquared International
item.description: Colin Hunter is an author, mentor, coach and founder of a business Potential Squared that specializes in creating playgrounds to disrupt the way people are led. He lives with his family, near London, but originally from Scotland and still retains his love of the Scottish mountains and the outdoors. Colin and his team work with their clients to provide leaders and their teams the chance to, as he describes, “Sail their ship out of the harbor and test themselves in rougher seas”. He is a practitioner and his work and his book are based on personal experience and purposeful practice with his clients.

item.title: Ep418: Ido Safruti | Co-founder and CTO, PerimeterX
item.description: Ido Safruti is the co-founder and CTO at PerimeterX, a behavior-based web security service. At PerimeterX Ido owns the product vision and delivery with Product and R&D reporting to him. Prior to founding PerimeterX, Ido was Sr. Director of Product-Management at Akamai, joining Akamai through the acquisition of Cotendo, where he was VP of product and strategy. He started his cybersecurity career in Israeli intelligence after graduating from the Talpiot program.

item.title: Ep417: Uri Gruenbaum | CEO and Co-Founder, TipRanks
item.description: Uri is the CEO and Co-Founder of TipRanks, a fast-growing financial accountability engine that helps millions of users make better financial decisions. In high school, he moved to a boarding school in Sde Boker and then served as a drone pilot in the IDF Air Force. After studying computer science at the Hebrew University followed by an MBA from TAU, he worked as a software engineer at Avaya, Convergin (now Oracle), and ARX (now DocuSign).

item.title: Ep416: Omer Orlev | Director, Retail Sales and Growth, Wolt
item.description: Omer is Director of Retail Sales at Wolt, leading Wolt's global efforts with regards to its expansion from restaurant delivery to new verticals like grocery, florists, electronics and more. Before joining Wolt, he served as a commander in a technology unit in the Israel Army,  practiced law as a high tech lawyer in one of the leading law firms in Israel, and spent 5 years in HP Indigo as head of Business Operations in Indigo's Growth Team.

item.title: Ep415: David Maman | Founder & CEO, Binah.ai
item.description: David is the co-founder and CEO of Binah.ai, an innovative and successful start-up that is transforming the way healthcare services are being delivered and consumed. David is spearheading the Binah.ai team towards its mission to make healthcare services available to anyone, anywhere, anytime. Using its award-winning technology, Binah.ai allows users to extract vital signs and mental stress levels just by looking at a smartphone, tablet or laptop camera. A serial entrepreneur, David is currently leading his 13th startup, after driving numerous start-ups from vision to international success, including Hexatier (acquired by Huawei), Precos, Vanadium-soft, GreenCloud, Teridion, and more.

With a passion for tech and scaling teams, he has been active in the SaaS space as a founder, advisor and investor. Perry believes in the power of HR tech to help revolutionize the way companies and teams grow.

item.title: Ep413: Michael Malul | CEO, Shareitt
item.description: Michael swam for 20 years his my life. Holding a national swimming record for 18 years to this date (including Israel's athlete of the year 2007 - Ma'ariv). Studied and swam for the Georgia Institute of technology in the states. Spent the last 11 years leading design and development of products using mobile technology for startups and fortune 500 companies. Father of 2 amazing kids, Married to Hen and lives in Tel-Aviv.

item.title: Ep412: Dror Benjamin | Founder & CEO, VidiPlus
item.description: Dror Benjamin is a serial entrepreneur, visionary, and world-recognized expert in visualization and video content. His concepts are not only unique but also help generate revenue streams for Medical Device giants. Dror’s ability to recognize future trends enabled him to successfully expand Arcreative, a virtual design house specializing in visual content, and also venture off into several other areas. Benjamin’s most recent mission is to help people overcome remote work and digital challenges, by bringing AR videoconferencing software VidiPlus to millions.

item.title: Ep411: Ofir Azury | Head of Technology Investments, Gandyr Investment Group
item.description: Ofir Azury is a technology and impact investor and serves as the Head of Technology Investments at Gandyr Investment Group, focusing on early-stage start-ups within the areas of AI, SaaS, Digital Health and Corporate SW. Some of its portfolio ventures include companies such as Yotpo, Mobileye, Nutrino, Anyword, NYM, Software, Ecoppia, Eleos Health and others.

item.title: Ep410: Sagi Eliyahu | CEO, KMS Lighthouse
item.description: Sagi is the CEO of KMS Lighthouse, a global leader in knowledge management software. Over the last 4 years, he managed to take KMS from a small boutique start-up to a company that serves Fortune 500 global brands. Sagi has extensive knowledge in building and scaling up businesses and starting new innovations. He established the international business division of  Israeli IT giant Aman Group, from zero, more than 15 years ago and has managed to grow the business year-over-year.  Sagi worked at KPMG in the hi-tech group assisting startups in fundraising and go-to-market plans. He also holds a BA in Business Administration, an MBA from the College of Management and is a Certified Accountant.

item.title: Ep409: Shai Policker | CEO, MEDX Xelerator LP
item.description: In the last 20 years, Shai has been leading the development, clinical validation and commercialization of innovative medical devices for various indications such as heart failure, metabolic and gastrointestinal diseases. Shai holds an Electrical Engineering degree from the Technion, Israel Institute of technology and an MBA from Columbia University. He is an inventor of 40 issued patents. He currently serves as the CEO of the MEDX Xelerator, a leading medical device and digital health incubator, a partnership of Boston Scientific, MEDX Ventures, Intellectual Ventures and the Sheba medical center.

item.title: Ep408: Shai Morag | CEO & Co-founder, Ermetic
item.description: Previously he co-founded and was CEO of Secdo, a cybersecurity company, that was acquired by Palo Alto Networks and of Integrity-Project, a company specialized in connectivity, networking, and security solutions acquired by Mellanox. Shai served for 10 years as an officer in the IDF Intelligence Corps Unit 8200, where he held a variety of roles in management and product development and won several national awards for excellence. Shai is a graduate of the Talpiot program and earned an MBA from Tel Aviv University.

item.title: Ep407: Mital Makadia | Partner, Grellas Shah LLP
item.description: Mital Makadia is a partner at Grellas Shah, and co-founder of Solvd4, a cost-effective alternative dispute resolution service aimed at founders and startups. Her practice is focused on representing technology startups and startup founders. She provides counsel on a variety of corporate and transactional matters and negotiates and structures equity financings, M&A transactions, and commercial and intellectual property transactions for her clients. A TechCrunch Verified Expert Lawyer, Mital is passionate about helping startups succeed by equipping founders with the legal tools and knowledge they need to support their employees, protect business relationships, and drive growth.

item.title: Ep406: Mike Silberg | Founding Partner, IS-CL
item.description: Since 2002, Mike has worked with companies such as Rebull as a Brand Manager, at KPMG in the Management Consulting team, and at Wework as a CM, but also SMBs, NGOs and Gov. In 2017 he founded the IS-CL Summit (International Startup Community Leaders Summit) the event that brought together 500 startup community professionals from over 50 countries! The event spawned his agency, IS-CL (AKA; The IS-CL Network) a decentralized community agency working with companies and organizations around the world.

Vivek has a natural passion for improving leadership by understanding the neuroscience behind social dynamics in a workplace.

item.title: Ep404: Amir Zwickel | Co-Founder & CRO, SHOWFIELDS
item.description: Amir is a serial entrepreneur with a specialization in Real Estate Development. He earned his Bachelor’s in Law and Business and his Masters in Law from IDC, his Masters in Political Science from Tel Aviv University, and his Masters in Real Estate Development from Columbia University in the City of New York. At Showfields, Amir oversees the Revenue team and leads the real estate part of the venture, from Construction to sourcing and negotiating new properties as part of overseeing Showfields growth plans and extension strategy.

item.title: Ep402: Neta Rozy | Co-founder & CTO, Parametrix Insurance
item.description: Neta was born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area (Silicon Valley), moved to Israel to enlist in the IDF as a lone soldier, and then moved back to the US to work as a software engineer and team lead. What grounded her in Israel was meeting the now co-founders of Parametrix. The company’s mission is to ensure that companies with mission-critical services in the cloud are fully protected from the financial damages of downtime caused by SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS such as cloud, eCommerce, payments, CRM, and CDN service providers.
