item.title: Ep96: Gil Frostig | Prev a VP (Intel and Qualcomm), and Strategic Investor
item.description: Gil is a veteran high-tech executive with 35 years of management and leadership experience. During his career at Intel (VP), he led several mergers and acquisitions, and managed organizations of up to 2,000 engineers around the world (including developing the solution that kicked off the global WiFi revolution). As VP R&D of Qualcomm, he led the development of Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and NFC technologies and products. Currently Gil 's focus is on startups and J-Ventures roles.

item.title: Ep97: Lisandro Brill | Latin America Venture Capitalist
item.description: Lisandro is one of the pioneers of the venture capital industry in Latin America (J-Ventures LP for Latin American Community, AxiaVentures, AltaVentures – México & USA -, OIKOS AgriFoodTech. He is focused on creating and investing in companies that improve the lives of people around the world, especially in developing areas, and his investments have amounted to multiple exits and IPOs. He holds a BA in Economics (Cum Laude) from University of Buenos Aires, and a MPA from Harvard Kennedy School of Government.

He previously led technology and strategy and 3 other startups that were acquired, and joined Quantum Technology Ventures as a general partner. Shmuel is passionate about mentoring, coaching, and advising young entrepreneurs.

item.title: Ep100: Laura Lauder | Lauder Family Venture Philanthropy Fund
item.description: Laura is a social entrepreneur and venture philanthropist in Silicon Valley, focusing on Signature Initiatives that she has designed and launched with experts and other philanthropists. Her initiatives include the Center for Media and Democracy in Israel: (A ProPublica model in Israel), DeLeT: A Jewish Teach-for-America and a Jewish Teen Philanthropy program worldwide.. She serves on 11 nonprofit and foundation boards, is an avid cyclist and, in 2009, won a bronze medal in the Maccabi Games in Israel!

item.description: Taly is VP of Global Business Development & Alliances at Ayehu Software, a high growth startup transforming Enterprise IT Process Automation through leveraging AI and ML. Previously, she was VP of Business Development at Uptima and held leadership positions at IVN, CaesarStone, Unilever, and Super-Pharm. item.title: Ep92: Gil Ben Artzy | Founding Partner of UpWest
item.description: Gil is the Founding Partner of UpWest, the only Seed fund that's purposefully designed to help Israeli startups break into the US market. UpWest was the first investor in "unicorn" SentinelOne and its portfolio companies have raised well over $1B in follow-on funding from top US VCs. Previously, Gil was part of the Corporate Development group at Yahoo! and served as a consultant advising Fortune 500 companies for the Boston Consulting Group in New York.

item.title: Ep91: Julie Zelenski | Computer Science Lecturer at Stanford University
item.description: Julie gew up in a town with a population of 262, and came to Stanford for her undergraduate degree. Upon graduating she joined Steve Jobs at NeXT in 1989 and continued with Apple on the MacOS X team. She later fell in love with teaching and became a full-time Stanford lecturer, providing inspiration to thousands of students. Julie also served on the Computer Science Advancement Placement development committee, writing and grading an exam for 20,000 students (AP Computer Science).

item.description: David is a Stanford Business School Professor and has held numerous executive positions in communications and strategy. He was an assistant to President George H. W. Bush and member of the White House senior staff, was head of communications at Bank of America, head of brand management at Visa and most recently Stanford’s senior public affairs official.

item.title: Ep94: Cindy Padnos | Founder & Managing Partner at Illuminate Ventures
item.description: Cindy is the founder and Managing Partner of Illuminate Ventures, a seed stage firm investing exclusively in Enterprise/B2B software startups. Previously, she was founder/CEO of SaaS startup Vivant (now part of Oracle), CEO of Acumen and VP marketing at Scopus (IPO then acquired by Siebel). Cindy has been recognized as one of the Most Influential Women in Tech (Fast Company), Most Influential Women in Silicon Valley (New York Times) and dubbed ”Queen B2B” (VentureBeat).

item.title: Ep89: Irina Meyer | Managing Director of Sils Capital Emmy Award Winner
item.description: Irina is a director, adviser and often majority stake investor in the fund's portfolio companies. Fluent in 6 languages, Irina is working with ventures in Switzerland, Israel, US and China. Irina's core expertise is in development and promotion of new technologies in digital media and interactive entertainment. She is an active member of the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences and the Emmys Foundation. Irina is a recipient of the 2011 Emmy for the Outstanding Achievement in Interactive Media

Previously Yitz was the Founder and Chief Executive Officer at Concorde Solutions Inc., which he sold to Bank of America where he held an SVP position. item.title: Ep86: Assaf Wand | CEO and Co-Founder at Hippo
item.description: Assaf is the CEO and co-founder of insurtech startup Hippo, a company that is reimagining home insurance through the lens of homeowners - more comprehensive coverage at up to 25% less than competitors. Previously he founded Sabi (acquired), was a consultant with McKinsey & Company and invested with Intel Capital. Assaf holds an MBA from University of Chicago and a BA in finance and LLB in law from IDC Herzliya.

item.title: Ep87: Shuli Gilutz | UX Researcher at Children's Technology
item.description: Shuli Gilutz, Ph.D. specializes in UX research, assessment, and design of interactive products for children. She works in industry and academia, teaching, advising, and conducting research, as well as a strategic consultant for the development and design of children's digital experiences. Dr. Gilutz is a global speaker about kids and digital media, age-appropriate UX, usability, play, and learning. She teaches at Tel-Aviv University, Shenkar’s Toy Invention program, and is a board member of the Designing for Children's Rights Association.

item.title: Ep88: Tomer Cohen | Co-Founder of Tech2Peace
item.description: Tomer Cohen is a social entrepreneur and the Co-Founder of Tech2Peace, the winner of the presidential Israeli Hope award. Tech2Peace brings together young Arabs and Jews from Israel and the Palestinian territories for intensive seminars that focus on peacemaking, entrepreneurship, and technological training, while their partners include Google, MIT (MISTI), Microsoft, etc.
item.dc:creator: Michael Matias
item.itunes:summary: Tomer Cohen is a social entrepreneur and the Co-Founder of Tech2Peace, the winner of the presidential Israeli Hope award. Tech2Peace brings together young Arabs and Jews from Israel and the Palestinian territories for intensive seminars that focus on peacemaking, entrepreneurship, and technological training, while their partners include Google, MIT (MISTI), Microsoft, etc.

item.title: Ep82: Yael Shemer | Co-Founder and CMO of TULU
item.description: Yael is the co-founder and CMO of TULU, a startup that aims to reshape the way people use and consume household products in buildings, neighborhoods, and offices. It is a smart rental room (accessible by an app), that leverages data analysis and smart maintenance. The company has 20 locations across Tel Aviv, New York, and New Jersey. Previously Yael was an environmental activist and promoted ventures in urban farming, food waste and renewable energy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Matias

item.title: Ep84: Michal Segalov | Director of Engineering at Google
item.description: Michal is a Director of Engineering at Google. She currently leads teams working on Natural Language Understanding, and previously worked on the Google Play team focusing on consumer features, Play Games APIs for developers, Google’s Networking infrastructure and YouTube. Michal co-initiated Mind The Gap, a program aimed at encouraging high school girls to select computer science and math as their high-school major. The program expanded globally and is now in its 8th year, with more than 50,000 participants to date.

item.title: Ep81: Kobi Mahat | Actor and Movie Producer
item.description: Kobi Mahat is one of the most well known and respect Israeli TV personas. He appeared in over 10,000 hours of live TV at the "children's channel" and has since acted in dozens of films and TV shows. Most recently Kobi is an accomplished film producer, having written and directed some of Israel's most well-known films. He holds a B.A in Psychology and a Masters in Organizational Behavior from Tel Aviv University.

item.title: Ep83: Aaron Tartakovski | Co-Founder and CEO of Epic CleanTec
item.description: Aaron Tartakovsky is co-founder and CEO of Epic CleanTec, a sustainability startup redefining how cities manage their water. He previously served as Director of Business Development and Marketing for CB Engineers, overseeing its R&D division. Prior to that he worked in federal politics and has remained active in affecting public policy on the local, state, and national levels. In 2017 he was recognized as a GreenBiz 30 under 30 honoree. Aaron is also a founding member and investor in the Silicon Valley-based J-Ventures Fund.

item.title: Ep85: Nir Bar-Lev | Co-Founder and CEO of Allegro AI
item.description: Nir began his hi-tech career in the IDF and since then has spent almost 30 years in the industry in leadership positions. After completing his MBA at Wharton (BSc CS in Technion), he was one of the founding members of the Google R&D center in Tel Aviv and worked in GM leadership roles within the company (search advertising in EMEA, GM of Bebapay). Currently Nir is the co-founder and CEO of Allegro AI.

item.title: Ep77: Nicole Priel | Vice President at Ibex Investors
item.description: Nicole is an early stage investor with Ibex Investors where she focuses on Israeli tech startups. She serves as a mentor in several accelerators and is an active member of the startup ecosystem in Israel. In her spare time she enjoys connecting job seekers with jobs, leading the Brandeis Alumni Club of Israel, reading, and playing tennis. She lives in Raanana with her husband and their 3 children.

item.title: Ep79: David Tabachnikov | CEO of ScholarshipOwl
item.description: David is the CEO of ScholarshipOwl, where he is fighting student debt by redefining the way American students pay for their education. He and his team have recently launched the Future Minds Fund, that allows direct financial support for students through crowdfunded scholarships. Previously, David was a part of Google and Waze, and he is an expert on distributed teams, and remote-by default companies. He is a dedicated professional and a tech savvy entrepreneur, bringing humanity and technology closer.

item.title: Ep78: Elia Gourgouris | Founder and President of the Happiness Center
item.description: Dr. Gourgouris is an International Keynote speaker and a #1 Best-selling author of “7 Paths to Lasting Happiness”. After becoming a National Swim Champion of Athens (Greece), he received his BA, MD and PhD in Psychology. He founded the Happiness Center, an organization of world leading experts in the field of Positive Psychology, and has helped thousands of individuals and companies achieve happiness, success and corporate wellness.

item.title: Ep80: Mor Chen | Managing Director at 8200 For Startups by EISP
item.description: Mor is the Managing Director of 8200 For Startups by EISP, one of the leading startups accelerator in Israel. She founded the 8200 Alumni Association first female entrepreneurship program and the first startup accelerator for reserve duty soldiers. She is a tech and strategy enthusiastic, previously working as a software engineer at VMware and as a strategy consultant at Strategy& (previously Booz& Company). Mor is passionate about bringing more women into STEM and developing the next generation of women leaders.

item.title: Ep76: Steven R. Gerbsman | Managing Principal at Gerbsman Partners
item.description: Steven is an internationally recognized Crisis/Turnaround CEO/Restructuring Professional, Private Investment Banker and Angel Investor who has been involved in maximizing enterprise value, stakeholder and shareholder value in a broad variety of industries. With 51 years experience of senior management and having been involved in deals amounting to $2.3B, he helped over 105 companies maximize their enterprise value. Steven is an investor in J-Ventures.

item.title: Ep74: Alon Alroy | Co-Founder and CMO (and CCO) of Bizzabo
item.description: Alon is the Co-Founder, CMO & CCO of Bizzabo, an all-in-one Event success platform and one of the fastest-growing event tech companies in the world. He was named one of the meetings industry's "40 under 40 young leaders” by Collaborate Magazine, and one of the top 10 Israeli CMOs by Geektime.com. Alon was a member of the exclusive NYC Venture Fellows Program and graduated with high honors from the IDC and the Zell Entrepreneurship program.

item.title: Ep71: Eli Bildner | Co-Executive Director at Concourse Education
item.description: Eli's experience spans entrepreneurship, philanthropy, and politics. As an early employee at Coursera, Eli helped lead the company's international expansion, growing the platform to a million Chinese users in just over a year. Eli has also consulted on housing policy for the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative and on education for Bloomberg Philanthropies, and managed a winning political campaign in rural Alaska.

item.title: Ep73: Anat Binur | Co-founder and CEO of UkkoPrev. Investment Partner, Innovation Endeavors
item.description: Anat is the co-founder and CEO of Ukko Inc., a biotech startup backed by top-tier Silicon Valley VCs which is solving food allergies and sensitivities. Previously, Anat was an Investment Partner at Innovation Endeavors, a venture firm backed by Alphabet’s Eric Schmidt. Anat also worked for Israel’s State Attorney, on Capitol Hill and with the World Bank. She received her PhD from MIT, an MPA from Columbia University and a law degree from Hebrew University.

item.title: Ep72: Daniel Tal Mor | Co-founder and CEO at Lumen
item.description: Daniel is the co-founder and CEO of Lumen, a company developing consumer nutrition management platform based on a small device that measures metabolism in a single breath and provides personalized food, lifestyle, and health recommendations. Lumen sold 10,000 devices on Indiegogo during the pre-campaign. Previously, Daniel co-founded Wibiya, acquired by Conduit, and later held VP roles at Conduit.

item.title: Ep75: Keren Herskovici | Co-Founder and Managing Director, Woman2Woman
item.description: Keren is Co-Founder and Managing Director of 8200 Woman2Woman. She works as a Finance Manager at a cybersecurity company founded by 8200 alumni. Previously Herscovici worked as the Israeli Accounting Manager at Check Point Software Technologies and as a valuation and strategy consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers, leading projects for some of the largest companies in Israel. Herscovici also served in various roles for Unit 8200 of the Israeli Intelligence Corps and is currently a board member of the 8200 Alumni Association

item.title: Ep66: Hadar Pode | Director of Porsche Digital Tel Aviv
item.description: Hadar is the Director of Porsche Digital in Tel Aviv, responsible for scouting for companies and technologies that can transform Porsche through projects and investments. Previously, she led Deloitte’s new startups practice, where she and her team provided growth opportunities to leading startups as well as tech scouting services for Fortune 500 companies. Hadar is a certified lawyer with experience in the M&A space, and is an alumni of the IDF 8200 unit.

item.title: Ep67: Larry Diamond | Senior Fellow at the Hoover Institution, Stanford University
item.description: Larry Diamond is a senior fellow at the Hoover Institution and at the Freeman Spogli Institute for International Studies. He is the founding coeditor of the Journal of Democracy and also serves as senior consultant at the International Forum for Democratic Studies of the National Endowment for Democracy. His research focuses on democratic trends and conditions around the world and on policies and reforms to defend and advance democracy.

item.title: Ep69: Liran Yaacobi | Theater Educator
item.description: Liran is a theater educator at the Walworth Barbour American International School in Israel. She teaches Drama from pre-school to high school students and directs two theater productions each year.  After years of academic studies and working in start-up companies, she decided to go back to her childhood passion and studied physical theater under the instruction of Sofi Moskowitz. She found her true passion combining her love for the stage and her love of teaching, and has been doing so for over a decade.

item.title: Ep70: Dani Arnaout | Tech Speaker & Author at Forbes 30 Under 30
item.description: Dani is the co-founder and CTO of Saily, one of the top ranking shopping apps on the App Store with over 500,000 users (acquired). He was featured on Forbes’s 2018 30 Under 30 list in Enterprise Technology for his work on Abstract Layer, programming AI that automates software development. He is a Global Facilitator at Techstar’s Startup Weekend and has hosted various events all over the Middle East, Europe, & the US.

item.title: Ep68: Jeremy Rossmann | Co-Founder of Make School
item.description: Jeremy dropped out of MIT to found Make School, a new college offering a project-based Bachelor's in Applied Computer Science. Their students have gone on to get jobs at Facebook, Google, Apple, and other top companies and startups. They recently designed a new student loan protection plan to ensure that no graduate has to pay their student loans unless they have a job.

item.title: Ep63: Gigi Levy Weiss | Founding Partner at NFX
item.description: Gigi is a founding partner of NFX (www.nfx.com), a $275m leading seed venture firm in Silicon Valley and Israel. He founded 6 startups over the years including Playtika and Inception and invested in many others including Kenshoo, Moon Active, Plarium, MyHeritage, Optimove, Selina, Houseparty, R2Net, SimilarWeb, NanoRep, Replay Technology, SpaceApe and others. Gigi serves on the Supervisory Board of Bertelsmann as well as on the client advisory council of Facebook.

item.title: Ep64: Or Matias | Broadway Musical Director, Composer & Writer
item.description: Or is a composer, music director, and music producer. He has worked extensively on and off Broadway (The Great Comet of 1812, Preludes, Octet), and has collaborated with artists such as Josh Groban, the Trans Siberian Orchestra, and others. His compositions for theater have been performed worldwide, and his work has garnered numerous awards and nominations. A graduate of both Juilliard and NYU, he continuously strives to bridge the gap between various musical genres.

item.title: Ep61: Itai Pinki | Professional Stand Up Magician
item.description: Itai is an Israeli magician & stand-up comedian, having performed and emceed conferences all over the world for over 15 years (most notably in front of the biggest tech companies one can imagine). Due to his ability to effectively convey promotional messages, companies have chosen him as a presenter on social media. He has weekly spots on several TV shows, and co-founded a weekly dinner-show, "Sorcerers Night", that has been ranked #1 activity in Tel Aviv since 2014.

item.title: Ep62: Nadine Kreisberger | President of Neidan Inc
item.description: In her counseling work, Nadine combines her original background in psychology, business, politics, the media, shamanism & wisdom schools. She grew up in Paris, developed a classical music company in New York, spent time near the lava flows in Hawai’i, was the right hand of the leading female politician in Mongolia, had a therapy practice and TV shows in New Delhi. She is now working as a “Joint Journeyer” (a term she prefers to coach or therapist) in the Bay Area and around the world.

item.title: Ep60: Zoe Littlepage | Trial Lawyer at Littlepage Booth
item.description: Zoe is one of America’s most respected litigators, having achieved more than $500M in jury verdicts and settlements for her clients. This includes more than a dozen trials on hormone therapy chases that resulted in verdicts in excess of $260M. She is passionate about complex cases including mass torts, defective medical products or drug cases, as well as human rights issues. Besides litigation, Zoe is an avid Burning Man participant and an incredible adventurer!

item.title: Ep59: David Paluy | CTO of Stride Travel
item.description: David is a serial entrepreneur, co-founded 3 startups, and built 6 marketplaces (3 of which exited). He has almost 20 years of engineering and startup experience and has been fortunate to invest in, advise, and mentor many startups in a variety of industries. Today, David is the CTO of Stride Travel, the #1 US marketplace for multi-day tours and adventure travel packages.

item.title: Ep58: Yaron Carni | Founder of Maverick Ventures
item.description: Yaron is the founder of Maverick Ventures. Previously, he founded the Tel Aviv Angel Group where he was involved in business development for its portfolio companies and five exits. He is a graduate of Zell Entrepreneurship Program (IDC) and holds an MS in Law. Yaron sits on the board of the United Hatzalah (non-profit Emergency Medical Services Organization which consists of over 6,000 volunteer first responders).

item.title: Ep56: Marcel Kornacker | Founder of Apache Impala
item.description: Marcel Kornacker is a tech lead at Cloudera and the architect of Apache Impala (incubating). Marcel has held engineering jobs at a few database-related startup companies and at Google, where he worked on several ad-serving and storage infrastructure projects. His last engagement was as the tech lead for the distributed query engine component of Google’s F1 project. Marcel holds a PhD in databases from UC Berkeley.

Sapir is also a Board Member of the 8200 Alumni Association. In 2017 she founded the 8200 Alumni Youth Community and has been leading it since.

item.title: Ep53: Sean Sternbach | Co-founder of Venture Out, previously Senior PM at Amazon, Co-Founder at Gingr (acquired)
item.description: Sean is the co-founder and a Managing Director of Venture Out, a company dedicated to helping founders with big tech day jobs validate their startup idea before pursuing it full-time. Previously he was the entrepreneur in residence (EIR) for the Techstars Alexa accelerator, was Senior Product Manager at Amazon, and sold a B2B SaaS company, Gingr. He holds an MBA from the University of Chicago, Booth School of Business.
item.dc:creator: Michael Matias
item.itunes:summary: Sean is the co-founder and a Managing Director of Venture Out, a company dedicated to helping founders with big tech day jobs validate their startup idea before pursuing it full-time. Previously he was the entrepreneur in residence (EIR) for the Techstars Alexa accelerator, was Senior Product Manager at Amazon, and sold a B2B SaaS company, Gingr. He holds an MBA from the University of Chicago, Booth School of Business.

item.title: Ep54: Shahar Markovich | Chief Digital & Information Officer of EL AL Israel Airlines
item.description: Shahar is the Chief Digital and Information Officer of El Al Israel Airlines, aiming to make it “the Smart Airline for the Startup Nation". Previously he was the Chief Digital Officer of Bank Hapoalim (Israel’s largest bank), where amongst many things he helped launch Bit (Israel's largest p2p payment app). He was recognized as Israel "top 100 influential people" in digital for 2017.

item.title: Ep46: Laura Smoliar | Founding Partner at Berkeley Catalyst Fund
item.description: Laura has spent nearly two decades in Silicon Valley’s technology sector, with vast experience in building strategic partnerships and raising funds from Asia, harnessing the best assets of large corporations and small companies. Recently she has developed a hybrid investment model (containing non-profit and for-profit components), working closely with the University of California, Berkeley, to create the Berkeley Catalyst Fund.

item.title: Ep49: Dan Seider | Founder of Misu
item.description: Inspired by deep depression and advice from his mental health professionals, Dan taught himself to code and built one of the highest rated manual mood trackers. To help himself and others keep up the habit of mood tracking and advance the state of the art mental health technology, Dan is working on Misu — an automated mood tracker that tracks happiness and anxiety their micro facial expressions passively throughout the day.

item.title: Ep50: Pamela Becker | VP Marketing at prooV | Author | Speaker
item.description: Pamela has been a marketing executive for some of Israel’s leading tech companies including prooV, ironSource, SafeCharge and Payoneer. After she was widowed with three small children in 2008, Pamela co-founded and remains the active chairperson of the Israeli charity Jeremy's Circle, which supports kids coping with cancer treatment or cancer loss in their immediate families. She is the author of the novel Memoirs of a False Messiah.

item.title: Ep48: Dovi Frances | Financial Investor, contestant on Israeli Survivor
item.description: Dovi is an entrepreneur and Founding Partner of Group 11. He has invested over $150M in many of Silicon Valley’s most prominent and disruptive technology companies, including: SoFi, Addepar, Tipalti, TripActions, HomeLight, SunBit, Next Insurance and others. Previously, Dovi was VP at Deutsche Bank AG Private Bank and founded SG, a global financial advisory firm. He is also well known for his appearance as a “Shark” in the Israeli Shark Tank show.

item.title: Ep47: Gadi Ezra | Human Rights Lawyer
item.description: Gadi holds an unparalleled perspective on war – as both a human rights and as a soldier in the Israeli Special Forces. He was selected by Forbes Magazine as one of the most influential leaders in Israel under the age of 30 (the "30 UNDER 30" list), and holds three law degrees from Tel-Aviv University and NYU School of law. He is currently pursuing a PhD in Law, and and previously advised the Defense Establishment and headed the headed the Laws of War desk at the Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

item.title: Ep41: Omer Rozen | Financial Investor, contestant on Israeli Survivor
item.description: Omer began working in finance on Wall Street, and during the global financial crisis moved to work in Israel (followed by Australia and South America). There, he discovered Ayauasca and meditation, which paved his way to practice minimalism, spirituality, consciousness exploration and traveling. He was one of the most loved “survivors” of the Israeli Survivor reality show.

item.title: Ep42: Logan Ury | Director of Relationship Science of Hinge
item.description: Logan Ury is a behavioral scientist who focuses on dating. She wrote a forthcoming book with Simon & Schuster on how to use insights from behavioral science to make better decisions in romantic relationships. She studied psychology at Harvard University and ran the Irrational Lab, Google’s behavioral science team. She was a 2018 TED Resident.

He is a lawyer, has a Masters in Political Science and a Masters in Real Estate Development from Columbia University in New York.

item.title: Ep44: Alnisa Allgood | Founder of Collaboration for Good
item.description: Alnisa Allgood is the founder/director of Collaboration for Good— a dual focus nonprofit working to both 'change the face' of entrepreneurship and grow the capacity of the social sector. We use entrepreneurship, technology, and capacity building to make a social impact. Additionally, as a tech generalist, Alnisa founded Nonprofit Tech in 1998 as a national technology consultancy for nonprofits and public sector organizations.

item.title: Ep39: Mikey Fischer | PhD student at Stanford University
item.description: Mikey Fischer is a PhD student at Stanford University in Computer Science studying Artificial Intelligence and Natural Language Processing, where he is developing a system that translates natural language into code.  He was the head TA for “Regulating AI”, a class taught in the law school by a California Supreme Court Justice.  Mikey is currently writing a book, “Regulating AI”, exploring the intersection of AI and Law.

item.description: Maital is shaping the health-tech industry and driving the commercialization of advanced technologies that enable personalized care as head of global marketing for Roche Diagnostics Information Solutions. item.title: Ep31: Yair Vardi | Co-Founder and Partner of Fusion LA
item.description: Yair Vardi is a founding partner of Fusion LA - a venture-backed accelerator for Israeli start-ups in the US. To date, they invested in 43 startups, where 70% of their alumni have continued to raise $500K-$5M. Vardi completed military service as an officer in Israel's Intelligence Corps, Unit 8200. In 2018, Forbes Magazine named Vardi to its annual "30 Under 30" Israel list.

item.title: Ep33: Stuart Friedman | CEO of Stu Friedman Associates
item.description: Stuart is an industry recognized coach and trainer with an extraordinary understanding of how overcoming limiting beliefs and blind spots leads to stronger, more aligned relationships in today’s multicultural workplace. His clients include Genentech, Intel, Apple, Microsoft, Sony, and Nissan.  Stuart is a contributing author to Fortune.com, a TEDx speaker, and interviewed by Forbes, Bloomberg BusinessWeek, BBC and WCBS NewsRadio.

item.title: Ep35: Ivan Lee | CEO of Datasaur.ai
item.description: Ivan serves as the Founder and CEO of Datasaur.ai. Datasaur builds data labeling software for ML teams working on NLP. He's driven by building cohesive teams and crafting technological breakthroughs into meaningful user experiences.

item.title: Ep32: Neta Rivkin | Olympian (3 times), World Championship Medal
item.description: Neta is a 3 time Olympian competitor in rhythmic gymnastics and the first Israeli gymnast in history to win a medal in the world championship. She took part in seven World Championships, participating in 16 finals, and in 11 European Championships, reaching 14 finals. She has multiple medals from World Cups and the Grand Prix series. In her competing years, she would spend 270 hours a month in training to prepare for a 90-second performance.

item.title: Ep28: Katherine Tole | Professional Voice Actor
item.description: Katherine is a voice actor who has been singing and acting since she could hold a microphone. With a degree in Chemical Engineering and then a decade working in the fast-paced world of tech startups, she realized she was craving a return to her creative roots and started her own business.

item.title: Ep25: Danielle Strachman | Founder and General Partner at 1517
item.description: Danielle helped found the Thiel Fellowship, which provides $100k grants to young entrepreneurs. She's worked with some of the most prestigious founders like Vitalik Buterin and Ritesh Agarwal. Previous to her work with Peter Thiel, Danielle founded and directed Innovations Academy in San Diego, a K-8 charter school serving 400 students, with a focus on student-led project based learning and other alternative programs.

item.title: Ep24: Lior Zagury | an Entrepreneur, Operations & Business Development
item.description: Lior is one if the most modest talented and impressive people I have met. A distinguished lawyer and public servant, having worked for many years in the Prime Minister’s office on the most sensitive and of global influence matters, he shares his passion for Israel through his remarkable tour guides and the founding of non-profit group FFI (Friends for Israel). He is a devoted father and has recently completed a marathon (42km) doing 100m intervals (Corona lockdown), at his son’s request. He believes that the “cheapest” hours of the day are those when the kids are asleep; often he’ll complete 3-hour training sessions prior to sunrise in order to be able to cook his family breakfast as they wake up.

item.title: Ep23: Larry Klein | Mayor of Sunnyvale, California
item.description: Mayor Larry Klein represents the City of Sunnyvale’s over 155K residents, and moved to Sunnyvale more than 30 years ago. Prior to serving on the city council, Mayor Klein served 9 years on the Sunnyvale Planning Commission, as well as serving as board member for several local non-profits. Larry has extensive experience in Silicon Valley’s tech industry, trained as a software engineer, his current "day-job" is as a program manager at the East Bay Start-up, Qnovo.

In his free time, Mickey looks for ways to combine his passion for entrepreneurship with volunteer work and helping people.

item.title: Ep16: Shimon Tolts | CEO and Co-Founder of Datree
item.description: At 15 years old Shimon started his first company, providing web hosting on top of Linux servers in the pre-cloud era. He later managed the Software Engineering Infrastructure department for 400 engineers at ironSource. As an AWS Community Hero, he runs the largest AWS user-group worldwide and is an avid speaker at conferences. Today, Shimon is the CEO & Co-Founder at Datree, a git-based policy engine.

item.description: Dan is focused on the growth of Google's global enterprise hardware business. Previously, he served as the Head of Enterprise Solutions for Google Cloud Platform and as the EEMEA Region Lead for Amazon Web Services. With over 25 years of business and IT experience, he has built and led global Sales, Business Development and IT teams for public traded companies such as Google (GOOG), Amazon.com (AMZN), Clicksoftware (CKSW), Creo (Creo) and Scitex (SCIX).

item.title: Ep13: Roy Munin | Co-Founder and CEO of Made in Jerusalem
item.description: Roy is a community builder and the CEO of Made in JLM, a nonprofit organization developing the Jerusalem tech ecosystem. He was nominated Forbes Under 30, was one of 150 global fellows at Facebook's Community Leadership Program, helped found the Jerusalem hub for the World Economic Forum Global Shapers, and won the WeWork Creator Awards for his project Side Project Club

item.title: Ep12: Efrat Dagan | Global Head of Talent at Next Insurance
item.description: Efrat Dagan has joined as Head of Talent at Next Insurance a few months back. Previously, she has been with Lyft Level 5, Google and Waze. Efrat has led Google Israel Talent Acquisition team for a decade and later moved to Google HQ for a Global role. She was selected as one of the most prominent human resources professionals in Israel. She is also an active speaker and blogger about the future of work and careers.

item.title: Ep11: Slavik Markovich | SVP Product, Demisto at Palo Alto Networks
item.description: Slavik is a serial entrepreneur with a passion to solve hard technology problems. Along with co-founding Demisto (acquired by Palo Alto Networks) and Sentrigo (acquired by McAfee), he serves as board member and advisor to several security startups. Slavik has over 20 years of experience in infrastructure, security and software development. Previously, he was vice president of R&D and chief architect at DB@net, a leading IT architecture consultancy firm. He has contributed to many open-source projects and is a regular speaker at industry conferences

item.title: Ep8: Cliff Weitzman | Founder and CEO of Speechify
item.description: Cliff is an American Israeli entrepreneur, Founder of Speechify Text To Speech software - the 10th highest grossing productivity app on Apple's App Store, used to read more than a billion words every month. Cliff is one of the youngest people named to Forbes magazine's 30 Under 30 list. He is a Dyslexia advocate, listens to 100 books a year, & has the first chapter of harry potter memorized. Cliff is one of the CEOs discussed in the book The Great CEO Within.

item.title: Ep6: Oded Hermoni | Managing Partner at J-Ventures
item.description: J-Ventures is a community empowered VC fund based in Silicon Valley and backed by over 150 leading investors. Previously a Partner at Rhodium, and was a VP at Capital Point group (early stage traded investment firm). Founded a startup that was acquired by YellowPages group. He formed and led the largest Israeli Tech and VC organization (now called IATI) and was a founding member of ICON and INTRO. Before becoming a VC, Oded was an editor and journalist covering tech and economy at Haaretz/TheMarker/ Red Herring.

item.title: Ep10: Hillel Fuld | Startup Advisor and Tech Columnist
item.description: Hillel Fuld has been named the 7th top tech blogger worldwide, Israel’s top marketer, and on Forbes, was dubbed “The Man Transforming Startup Nation to Scale up Nation.”   He is a global speaker, tech blogger, startup marketer, and leading online influencer. Today, Hillel collaborates with companies such as Google, Oracle, and Microsoft to help early and later stage entrepreneurs take their local technology to a global scale.

item.title: Ep9: Katrina Yaukey | Broadway Actress and Musician
item.description: Katrina Yaukey is an actor musician who has appeared on Broadway, Film and TV and toured internationally.  She runs an accordion repair business in NYC and loves to talk about Volkswagens, pugs and plants.
item.dc:creator: Michael Matias

item.title: Ep7: Noa Shafir | Co-Founder & CPO of Odo Security
item.description: Noa started her journey as a network researcher in Israel's elite intelligence Unti 8200. Following that, Noa graduated with honors from her double degree in Mathematics and Computer Science, in parallel for conducting multiple research projects in Algorithmic Game Theory. During that time, she also worked as a Software Engineer at Google. After graduation, Noa co-founded Odo Security, a Cyber Security startup specializing in Zero-Trust Network Access. Totay, after raising a $ 5M Seed round, Odo consists of 20 employees and is working with leading organizations around the world.

item.title: Ep3: Alon Matas | Founder & President of BetterHelp
item.description: BetterHelp is the world’s largest counseling service. They connect people facing life's challenges with a counselor from their network of licensed, accredited, and board-certified therapists. Each month, over 2,000,000 counseling messages, chats, voice calls, and video sessions are facilitated through BetterHelp’s secure website and mobile app!

item.title: Ep4: Yasmin Lukatz | Executive Director of ICON
item.description: Yasmin Lukatz, MBA Stanford, Startup Investor and Philanthropist, is the Founder and Executive Director of ICON - Israel Collaboration network, helping Israeli entrepreneurs penetrate the US market by bridging Silicon Valley and Israel. ICON's members are VC Partners, Executives at Fortune 500 companies and Founders of rising-star startups. Yasmin only asks, is to pay it forward, and also pay it back by rallying the ICON community to support and mentor children in Israel's periphery.  Yasmin is also a respected startup investor, starring in the new season of the Israeli TV version of Shark Tank.

item.title: Ep5: Izhar Shay | Israeli Knesset, former VC
item.description: Prior to joining the Israeli Parliament, Shay was a high-tech entrepreneur, CEO of start-up companies, member in boards of directors, mentor for entrepreneurs and a social activist. He wrote a popular weekly column at Globes for 11 years, authored two books, and founded Israel’s largest digital community for entrepreneurs (“Start-Up Stadium”) with about 45 thousand members. Previously, Shay was a Managing General Partner with Canaan Partners Israel and was a board member with promising start-up companies, some of which reached significant ‘exit’ events.

item.title: Ep2: Shuly Galili | Founding Partner of Upwest
item.description: Shuly is the co-founding Partner at UpWest, a Silicon Valley seed fund investing in startups at the Israel-US technology junction. UpWest portfolio crossed $1B in VC funding and includes companies such as SentinelOne, HoneyBook, Stampli, CyCognito, Airobotics and more.

item.title: Ep1: Amir Shevat | Co-Founder and CPO, Reshuffle
item.description: Amir is a co founder at reshuffle, early-stage investor, and an author. Previously, he led initiatives at companies such as Google, Slack, Amazon Twitch and Microsoft. Amir is an innovator at heart.

item.title: Welcome to 20 Minute Leaders!
item.description: Welcome to Twenty Minute Leaders! In this introductory episode, host Michael Matias dives into his intentions for the show and what listeners can expect from future episodes.
